content.description: Climb straight up the arete between Lucy's Ladder and Gitchigumi Groupie
content.location: between Lucy's Ladder and Gitchigumi Groupie

content.description: Good warm up and place to run laps.
content.location: Little traverse wall on top off all the other boulders. Top out easy climb by lucy's ladder and you will see it. It starts all the way right and goes left and up.

content.description: Pretty fun little climb and I am no crack climber! I ended up doing a fun little bump/toss for the lip and that was the crux I thought.
content.location: Red line on photos, next to Oblivious.

content.description: Left hand on good hold with right hand on big hold/sidepull. Trend up and left and top out straight up. When you get to the top you can just top out to the right but going straight up gives a nice little mantel which is fun. If cleaned and a base is built above the water this line could start lower by the water level. We're working on it...
content.location: This line is to the left of Oblivious about 20 feet if you're looking at the rock. Walk the rocks and hop up on the little ledge of a rock to the start of this one.

climbs.name: Over the River and Through the Woods

content.description: SDS on broken sloped rail with feet on small rails. Due to the unique nature or this rock I did not use the rock protrusion just to the left for feet, it is more like the ground than part of the wall and much more fun without it. Move up through big holds and top out on sloped ledge. Cool movement and really awesome features and rock.
content.protection: Pad. Don't fall off or you may be getting wet!
content.location: Just downstream from the other routes. Look for the makeshift bridge and platform. The wall is literally right above the stream, and makes for a pretty sweet setting.

content.description: THe crux is right at the start where the crack is more of a seam more up into easier teritory and get some pro in.  Then move on to easier climbing to the top.  Can be bouldered at V0 R/X
content.protection: small cams or quite a few pads if you are stupid enough to boulder this.
content.location: To the right of the bouldering.  Climb the most obvious crack on the slab.

content.description: Super fun climb with the crux on the second half of the climb after you get the gaston pinch hold. Pretty tall and pretty scary, but a great landing is built. I did it solo since there really isn't room for a spotter anyways.
content.location: SDS left of Gitch. Groupie. To the left of the crack with the crack not on. Using the crack is Rotten Carcass. Sit start on two big good holds with awkward feet and move up to crimp with right hand and then to sweet gaston pinch. Then figure out feet to move up and left to pinch and then some sidepulls. Top out has huge holds but still freaky.

content.description: SDS made a bit awkward by the platform and vicinity of the stream. As long as you have a pad it is not as awkward. Use side pull and strange jug for start holds and move up through awesome features and finish on sloped ledge. Avoid mossy dihedral feature
content.location: Just downstream from the other problems. Look for the makeshift bridge and platform. Bare rock surrounded by a sea of moss.

content.description: Stand start with hands on obvious holds, smear on slab and follow semi-jug holds to the top.
content.location: On the far right face, around the corner from Gitchigumi Groupie .

content.description: The crux is probably the start? The sloppy edge/lip hold is super cool.
content.location: Located on sloppy boulder to the left. Sit start on obvious sidepulls and move straight up to sloppy edge hold and up from there.

content.description: Around the corner to the left of Lucy's Ladder. Start on obvious ledge, to side pull, to double side pulls, and up to crimps to top.
content.location: Around the corner to the left of Lucy's Ladder.

content.description: Start of the right side of the sloppy boulder with left hand on decent hold and right hand on sidepull and trend left to the super cool little seam and then straight up. This boulder has some of the coolest features and texture I have seen, but it's sadly to featured to put out anything super awesome.
content.location: Sloppy boulder is in between the Zach attack wall and the main boulder you come to from the trail. If you get over the creek past PB & J you'll see it.

content.description: Traverse left starting on the far right side of the cliff on a ledge just above your head.  move through a tricky sequence to get around the arete and into the crux.  the begining is tough until you figure out the right sequence.
content.location: start to the right of reveling the beauty and traverse left around the arete and twords the dihedral.  top out just before the dihedral.  easy to figure out once you see it.

content.description: Rock outcropping by the creek, directly to the left of the path down to the creek.
